title: Elementary English 202
headline: Master the use of prepositions and learn vocabulary related to literature and buildings with this free online course.
description: Build on your English language skills in this course by discovering new vocabulary topics associated with novels and architecture. In the grammar section, you will review prepositions of time and place and understand general rules that apply to prepositional phrases used in speaking and writing. Once familiar with the vocabulary and grammar of this course, apply your skills to our comprehension and writing activities.
courseDescription:
Would you like to become more proficient in English and understand its many nuances? This course is the perfect tool to equip you with the skills necessary to become confident in the language. The first section of the course will look at vocabulary related to different kinds of novels, such as romance novels or fantasy. You will then move on to the language needed to describe buildings.

Following this, you will study prepositions in the grammar section. Prepositions are words placed before a noun to indicate the relationship of that noun to other words in the sentence. You will combine prepositions of place and time using the words 'in,' 'on,' and 'at' before discovering prepositions of movement, for example: 'down,' 'up,' 'around,' and 'to.' Next, you will look at prepositional phrases of time, place, and movement, a group of words within a sentence that starts with a preposition and ends with the preposition's object. End this section with a review of superlative adjectives, learning how to use prepositional phrases after superlative adjectives.

The course's final section deals mainly with enhancing your reading and listening comprehension abilities. Using the vocabulary and grammar skills you have gained through the course, you will practice speaking by asking and answering questions using what you have learned. You will complete the course with a downloadable writing task from the 'Resources' section. Don't delay! Register for the course today to acquire the grammar skills and vocabulary needed to be proficient in English!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard.
